revision.comment: [[WP:AES|‚Üê]]Created page with ''''Abdulla Rafiu''' is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] sports physician currently Minister of Sports, Fitness and Recreation ministry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=- The President's Office |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Government/Official/377 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=presidency.gov.mv}}</ref> Prior to that, he was Maldives Sports Council member.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-19 |title=Ex-sports physician as the new Sports Minister |ur...'
revision.text:
'''Abdulla Rafiu''' is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] sports physician currently Minister of Sports, Fitness and Recreation ministry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=- The President's Office |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Government/Official/377 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=presidency.gov.mv}}</ref> Prior to that, he was Maldives Sports Council member.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-19 |title=Ex-sports physician as the new Sports Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/ex-sports-physician-as-the-new-sports-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref> As a sports physician he led the medical team of the Maldivian contingent that took part in the 2015 and 2019 Indian Ocean Island Games (IOIG), and the 2023 IOIG held at Madagascar.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Former sports physician appointed as the new Sports Minister |url=https://edition.mv/news/30172 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=The Edition |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

'''Abdulla Rafiu''' is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] sports physician currently Minister of Sports, Fitness and Recreation ministry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=- The President's Office |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Government/Official/377 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=presidency.gov.mv}}</ref> Prior to that, he was Maldives Sports Council member.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-19 |title=Ex-sports physician as the new Sports Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/ex-sports-physician-as-the-new-sports-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref> As a sports physician he led the medical team of the Maldivian contingent that took part in the 2015 and 2019 Indian Ocean Island Games (IOIG), and the 2023 IOIG held at Madagascar.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Former sports physician appointed as the new Sports Minister |url=https://edition.mv/news/30172 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=The Edition |language=en}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

[[File:Abdulla_Rafiu_portrait.jpg|thumb|right]] '''Abdulla Rafiu''' is a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] sports physician currently Minister of Sports, Fitness and Recreation ministry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=- The President's Office |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Government/Official/377 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=presidency.gov.mv}}</ref> Prior to that, he was Maldives Sports Council member.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Reehaan |first=Mohamed |date=2023-11-19 |title=Ex-sports physician as the new Sports Minister |url=https://mbt.mv/ex-sports-physician-as-the-new-sports-minister/ |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=Maldives Business Times |language=en-US}}</ref> As a sports physician he led the medical team of the Maldivian contingent that took part in the 2015 and 2019 Indian Ocean Island Games (IOIG), and the 2023 IOIG held at Madagascar.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Former sports physician appointed as the new Sports Minister |url=https://edition.mv/news/30172 |access-date=2023-11-21 |website=The Edition |language=en}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]
